title: Trump says China, other countries can't have Nvidia's top AI chips
description: ARTIFICIAL intelligence (AI) giant Nvidia’s most advanced chips will be reserved for US companies and kept out of China and other countries, US President Donald Trump said.
content:

title: Bridgewater CIOs warn investors are underpricing risks to AI-fueled rally in S&P
description: Investors are overlooking mounting risks to the current market stability and the limits of the artificial intelligence boom, particularly in the United States, Bridgewater Associates' co-chief investment officers said in a note to clients on Monday.
content: Nov 3 (Reuters) - Investors are overlooking mounting risks to the current market stability and the limits of the artificial intelligence boom, particularly in the United States, Bridgewater Associates' co-chief investment officers said in a note to c... [2884 chars]

title: ChatGPT owner OpenAI signs $38bn cloud computing deal with Amazon
description: The seven-year agreement will see OpenAI gain access to Nvidia graphics processors to train its artificial intelligence models.
content:
OpenAI has signed a $38bn (£29bn) contract with Amazon to access its cloud computing infrastructure, as the start-up continues its run of major partnerships to secure computing power.
In 2025, the ChatGPT maker has signed deals worth more than $1tn w... [2728 chars]

title: Office robot fails a simple task - but nails Robin Williams impression
description: AI robot powered by LLMs hilariously mimics Robin Williams in office experiment, highlighting current challenges in embodied artificial intelligence.
content:
In a recent experiment that's as fascinating as it is funny, researchers at Andon Labs put today's top large language models (LLMs) to the test, by having them run a robot tasked with "passing the butter" in an office setting.
The goal? To see if the... [2297 chars]

title: AI may help identify Jews killed in Holocaust: Yad Vashem
description: Five million of the more than six million Jews killed in the Holocaust have now been identified, and with the further help of artificial intelligence, even more names could be recovered, Israeli researchers said on Monday.
content:
JERUSALEM - Five million of the more than six million Jews killed in the Holocaust have now been identified, and with the further help of artificial intelligence (AI), even more names could be recovered, Israeli researchers said on Monday.
